newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Han Joo misses deadline-creditor bank.
newsitem.headline: Han Joo misses deadline-creditor bank.

text.p: South Korean textile maker Han Joo missed the final deadline for repayments of promissory notes worth 450 million won on Monday, its creditor Cho Hung Bank and the Securities Supervisory Board said.
"They defaulted on the loans on Saturday first and failed to pay today, too," said a Cho Hung Bank official. "So we decided to let the company go."
"Han Joo informed us that it was unable to pay the loans today and was seeking a court receivership," he added.
Officials at Han Joo were not available for comment.
Stock brokers said Han Joo was believed to have suffered from financial troubles after it diversified into other businesses, including information technology.
Han Joo incurred losses of 8.52 billion won on sales of 52.15 billion in the first half of this year, compared to a net profit of 843 million won on 53.85 billion sales a year ago.
Trading of the stock was suspended on Monday after it defaulted on loans on Saturday, the Korea Stock Exchange said.
The stock would be traded on the exchange's "supervision list" from Wednesday, the exchange said.
The Securities Supervisory Board said Han Joo's debts totalled 128.2 billion won as of the end of June, compared with total assets of 186.1 billion won.
